channel.title: CVE Feed for GNU Project -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for GNU Project -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-28734|2024-08-03T06:03:52.014Z -- gnu%20project -- gnu%20grub
item.description: Out-of-bounds write when handling split HTTP headers; When handling split HTTP headers, GRUB2 HTTP code accidentally moves its internal data buffer point by one position. This can lead to a out-of-bound write further when parsing the HTTP request, writing a NULL byte past the buffer. It's conceivable that an attacker controlled set of packets can lead to corruption of the GRUB2's internal memory metadata.

item.title: CVE-2022-28736|2024-08-03T06:03:52.084Z -- gnu%20project -- gnu%20grub
item.description: There's a use-after-free vulnerability in grub_cmd_chainloader() function; The chainloader command is used to boot up operating systems that doesn't support multiboot and do not have direct support from GRUB2. When executing chainloader more than once a use-after-free vulnerability is triggered. If an attacker can control the GRUB2's memory allocation pattern sensitive data may be exposed and arbitrary code execution can be achieved.

item.title: CVE-2022-28735|2024-08-03T06:03:52.586Z -- gnu%20project -- gnu%20grub
item.description: The GRUB2's shim_lock verifier allows non-kernel files to be loaded on shim-powered secure boot systems. Allowing such files to be loaded may lead to unverified code and modules to be loaded in GRUB2 breaking the secure boot trust-chain.

item.title: CVE-2022-28733|2024-08-03T06:03:52.571Z -- gnu%20project -- gnu%20grub
item.description: Integer underflow in grub_net_recv_ip4_packets; A malicious crafted IP packet can lead to an integer underflow in grub_net_recv_ip4_packets() function on rsm->total_len value. Under certain circumstances the total_len value may end up wrapping around to a small integer number which will be used in memory allocation. If the attack succeeds in such way, subsequent operations can write past the end of the buffer.
